reviews.review_msg: One of the best professors I've taken at sfu - super interesting, was accommodating regarding office hours (she made appointments when people couldn't make her stated hours), gave extensions out like candy. i will say that participation DOES matter!! dropped my A to an A- but overall she is amazing!! HIGHLY recommend!!

I had the best of time in her class; she is caring for her students, and loves what she teaches. I do think she gives out A LOT of readings, but most often from larger books she only picks out chapters and not the whole book. She's flexible with due dates as long as it's reasonable, so I guess it's a fair compromise.

The most professional, caring and understanding professor I have ever met!! Lectures are entertaining, and engaging. She respects her students, the classroom environment is warm and welcoming. Would def take her class again.
She is great, super patient and cares about her students a lot, super clear on what she will test on, and she is not a hard grader.
Amazing prof! Very knowledgeable, sophisticated, open-minded, and cares very much about our learning. Best experience at SFU!
My favorite professor ever, she really cares about her students and makes you feel so welcome when you come to her. Will never forget her.

100% recommend taking a class with Eirini! She is energetic and approachable, which make you want to attend class . I'm thankful she is open minded, because I wrote my term paper on a really controversial topic. Definitely suggest seeing her during office hours, as she gave me helpful feedback. Would love to take more classes with her!

Amazing! Definitely my favourite prof during my uni career to date! She makes class very engaging and is super caring for all of the students. You will look forward to attending class and learning with her. Excellent lecturer and super knowledgeable. Also give great feedbacks. My only regret is not being able to attend any more courses with her.

Amazing prof who is very knowledgable and cares about her students. Inventive and imaginative with her lectures and takes on the material. While you have to work hard, you wont regret taking her class!!

Elrini is abosute fire, her class was interesting she is the most engagin and understanding proff that I have had the pleasure of being taught by. SHe genuinely cares about her students and is deeply invested in giving good feedback would 10/10 recommend her class. I got an A, and it was honestly becuase she was such a good proff i was motivated

Eirini is one of those very few people that you meet and you're like wow she actually genuinely cares about what she teaches. I think she is a great prof and a very passionate person in general. I took Hum 309 and although I had no interest in the spanish civil war she made it very interesting and she was quite helpful.
Straightforward, a lot of material, discussions, got good grade and had fun.
I was surprised by the amount of work this course had. She covered a lot of material so it was hard to follow at times but it was interesting overall.
The class was amazing. I don't know how she did it! If you need an elective, that's your course!!!!!!!
Excellent prof, great seminars. It was a very engaging course!
Lots of work, not easy for a student who is not in Humanities

Eirini is probably  one of the most open minded and engaging professors I have ever taken a course with.  Her lectures and essay assignments are long, but you get a lot of freedom during class discussion and in choosing how to go about your paper topic. If you need an elective course, I recommend that you take one with Eirini. Be prepared to read!
Loooooong papers.  Cool course though

I don't know how she was able to endure a weekly four hour long 8-12 morning class, but she did it anyway and kept the class awake.   Interesting course overall. Prof is excellent at providing feedback and encourages active discussion in the class through group work and dialogue.   No final, but be prepared to write a massive 15 page paper.
She's honestly one of my favourite professors. Lectures are clear and interesting, and I think she provokes thinking about real-life issues in unconventional ways that I can very much appreciate. :)
Very Interesting class. Fun assignments. No wasted time. Good lecturer. Very accommodating. Super helpful. Will take again.
eirini is the best
Interesting course. Learned a lot- very good prof. If you have the chance take the course.

She's a good prof. Not the best I've had, but not the worst - her lectures can be a bit dry at times. She is a fairly easy marker, so if you want a course that boosts your GPA, take a course with Kotsovili.

One of the best professors I've had at SFU! Really engaging, and class is enjoyable despite being 4 hours.  She super approachable and helpful in her office hours and is a fair marker.  I would love to take another course with her!

She is fantastic. Classes are hugely discussion-focussed, and she respects opinions. A lot of reading, but she goes over them and makes it both interesting and relevant. Really helpful, really friendly, and both marks fairly and is totally willing to explain her marking. If you have a chance to take a class with her, do it.

Eirini is probably one of the best professors I have had at SFU. She's enthusiastic, funny, and it's easy to tell that she is passionate about the course content. She manages to keep the class interesting despite it being 4 hours, and she's receptive to her students. Also very helpful during office hours, and a reasonable marker.
